# Data process


## Cuba

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `age` |
|----------|------------|
| **Label** | `participant age in years` |
| **Table name** | `1066-Cuba-Baseline` |
| **Description** |  |



```{r assign_cuba1, echo=F}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w1_age','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',
                         variables=list('age'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local_cuba1, echo=F}
t1066_cuba_w1_age <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w1_age')
vari <- t1066_cuba_w1_age$age
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")

ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1_age, aes(age)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("age") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable, but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_cuba1}
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w1_age$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$age <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w1_age$age, "NA=999")
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$age <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$age, labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba1, echo=F}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3])
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))$summary, caption = "Summary")

ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(age)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("age") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(64,110)
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation_cuba1, echo=F}
```


### Wave 2 

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name**        | `age` |
|-----------------|-|
| **Label**       | `participant age in years` |
| **Table name**  | `1066-Cuba-Baseline` |
| **Description** |  |


```{r assign_cuba2, echo=F}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w1_age','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',
                         variables=list('age'), missings = TRUE)
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w2_id','10-66.1066-Cuba-Followup',
                         variables=list('centreid'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local_cuba2, echo=F}
t1066_cuba_w1_age <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w1_age')
t1066_cuba_w2_id <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w2_id')

Same_indiv <- function(W1, W2){
  
  W1_2 <- matrix(rep(NA, dim(W1)[1]*dim(W1)[2] ), nrow = dim(W1)[1])
  W1m <- as.matrix(W1)
  
  for(i in 1:length(W1$id)){
    if(sum(W1$id[i]==W2$id)>=1){
      W1_2[i,] <- W1m[i,]
    } else {
      W1_2[i,] <- W1_2[i,]
    }
  }
  
  W1_22 <- data.frame(id=W1_2[,1], age=as.numeric(W1_2[,2]))
  W1_22[-which(is.na(W1_22$id)),]
}

t1066_cuba_w2_age <- Same_indiv(W1 = t1066_cuba_w1_age, W2 = t1066_cuba_w2_id)


vari <- t1066_cuba_w2_age$age
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")

ggplot(t1066_cuba_w2_age, aes(age)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("age") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable plus 5 years, but the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_cuba2}
t1066_ds_cuba_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w2_age$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$age <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w2_age$age+5, "NA=999")
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$age <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$age, labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba2, echo=F}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w2$age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3])
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))$summary, caption = "Summary")

ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w2, aes(age)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("age") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(64,110)
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation_cuba2, echo=F}
```

```{r assign_india2, eval=F}

```

```{r local_india2, eval=F}
t1066_india_w1_age <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_india_w1_age')
t1066_india_w2_dates <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_india_w2_dates')
t1066_india_w2_dates$diff_DATE <- as.numeric(t1066_india_w2_dates$fu_DATE-t1066_india_w2_dates$b_DATE)%/%356

vari <- t1066_india_w1_age$age
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")

kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = "Difference years between baseline and follow-up ") 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")



ggplot(t1066_india_w2_dates, aes(x=factor(diff_DATE))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Difference years between baseline and follow-up ") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable is the same than the study-specific variable plus the years between de first interview and the second one, furthermore the missing values have to be recoded as follows:

* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_india2,eval=F}

t1066_ds_india_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_india_w1_age$id)
t1066_ds_india_w1$age <- car::recode(t1066_india_w1_age$age, "NA='999'")

#First, it is added the age in baseline of the individues who participate in follow-up: 
Same_indiv <- function(W1, W2){
  W1_2 <- matrix(rep(NA, dim(W1)[1]*dim(W1)[2] ), nrow = dim(W1)[1])
  W1m <- as.matrix(W1)
  
  for(i in 1:length(W1$id)){
    if(sum(W1$id[i]==W2$id)==1){
      W1_2[i,] <- W1m[i,]
    }
  }
  
  W1_22 <- data.frame(id=W1_2[,1], age=as.numeric(W1_2[,2]))
  W1_22[complete.cases(W1_22),]
}

t1066_india_w1_age <- Same_indiv(W1 = t1066_ds_india_w1, W2 = t1066_india_w2_dates)
t1066_ds_india_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_india_w2_dates$id)
t1066_ds_india_w2$age <- t1066_india_w1_age$age + t1066_india_w2_dates$diff_DATE
t1066_ds_india_w2$age <- car::recode(t1066_ds_india_w2$age, "1000:hi='999' ;NA='999'")
t1066_ds_india_w2$age <- labelled(t1066_ds_india_w2$age, labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))$summary, caption = "Summary")

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}

labelling <- function(l.hds,m.hds){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
    aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
    # Labelling of variables
    label(l.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label
    # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
    l.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cont_label)
    aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
    # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
    m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
    rm(aux_object)
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}

# Creation of summary tables

summaries <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames){

  # Creation of column with summary table categories
  t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[1]][2])[1:6]
  # Adding of missing/no-missing values categories
  t.hds <- c(substr(t.summ,1,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)-1),labels(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[1]][[2]],missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table)[[2]])
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    # First, summary values
    t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[i]][2])[1:6]
    # Next, missing/no-missing values
    t.hds <- cbind(t.hds,c(as.numeric(substr(t.summ,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)+1,nchar(t.summ))),as.numeric(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[i]][[2]],missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table[1,])))
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds <- rbind(t.hds,c("sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))))
  # Add wave/population names
  dimnames(t.hds)[[2]] <- c(dimnames(summary(m.hds[[1]][2]))[[2]],lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}

# Save data tables

savingRD <- function(l.hds,vbl_name){
  
  for(index in seq_along(l.hds)){
    assign(vbl_name,l.hds[[index]])
    save(vbl_name,list = vbl_name, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.hds)[index],"/",vbl_name,".RData"))
  }
  
}

```

lmlist <- list(lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[1]]),m.hds)

if(length(l.hds)>0){
  # Labelling tibbles
  lmlist <- labelling(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]])
  # Printing summaries
  print(knitr::kable(summaries(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]],lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[2]])),caption=ds_label))
  # Saving tibbles
  savingRD(lmlist[[1]],vbl_name=hd_vbl)
}




# Consider only harmonised waves
l.hds <- lapply(f1066.cw, function(wname) if(exists(paste0("t1066_ds_",wname[1]))){wname = list(get(paste0("t1066_ds_",wname[1])),wname[2])})
nullw <- which(sapply(l.hds, is.null))

if(length(nullw)!=0){
  l.hds <- l.hds[-nullw]
}

m.hds <- list()

lmlist <- list(lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[1]]),m.hds)

if(length(l.hds)>0){
  # Labelling tibbles
  lmlist <- labelling(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]])
  # Printing summaries
  print(knitr::kable(summaries(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]],lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[2]])),caption=ds_label))

}
